article:
'Comedo extraction' is a widely-used method of treatment for acne vulgaris. {{cite journal |author=Taub AF |title=Procedural treatments for acne
vulgaris |journal=Dermatologic Surgery |volume=33 |issue=9 |pages=1005â26
|year=2007 |month=September |pmid=17760592 |doi=10.1111/j.1524-
4725.2007.33215.x}} A dermatologist or cosmetologist may extract
blackheads (open comedones) using gentle pressure around the pore opening, and
whiteheads (closed comedones) by incision with a large needle or a blade. {{cite journal |author=Gollnick H |title=Management of acne
|journal=J Am Acad Dermatol |volume=49 |issue=1 |pages=S1âS37 |year=2003
|month=July |pmid=12833004 |doi=10.1067/mjd.2003.618 |author-separator=,
|author2=Cunliffe W |display-authors=2 |last3=Berson |first3=Diane |last4=Dreno
|first4=Brigitte |last5=Finlay |first5=Andrew |last6=Leyden |first6=James J.
|last7=Shalita |first7=Alan R. |last8=Thiboutot |first8=Diane |author9=Global
Alliance to Improve Outcomes in Acne}}

If performed skillfully, this treatment may be beneficial to the patient. Possible negative effects of the procedure include incomplete
extraction, refilling, scarring and tissue damage. There
are few articles describing the use of comedo extraction in peer-reviewed
dermatology journals. In one 1964 study of extraction of non-
inflamed whiteheads on patients' foreheads (the only study of the procedure
cited in a 2007 literature review), the procedure reduced the number of future
inflamed lesions and the recurrence rate of comedones, but worsened patients'
inflamed cystic lesions. {{cite journal |author=Taub AF |title=Procedural
treatments for acne vulgaris |journal=Dermatologic Surgery |volume=33 |issue=9
|pages=1005â26 |year=2007 |month=September |pmid=17760592 |doi=10.1111/j.1524-
4725.2007.33215.x}} (Citing {{cite journal |author= Lowney E, Witkowski J,
Simons H, Zagula Z |title=Value of comedo extraction in treatment of acne
vulgaris |journal=JAMA |volume=189 |pages=1000â2 |year=1964 |month=September
|pmid=14188876 |doi= 10.1001/jama.1964.03070130020005 |issue= 13}})
